intro: Butayea congolana, commonly known as the Congo buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant features delicate, cup-shaped flowers with bright yellow petals and a hairy, glandular surface. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a rough texture and a strong, sometimes unpleasant odor. Butayea congolana is typically found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
